definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: There is a flaw in the dish.
sentences.chinese: 经常打碎盘子是她的一个老毛病。

sentences.english: It is incredible how parents and children never let go of old habits of relating.
sentences.chinese: 难以置信，家长和孩子还是由胡乱联系的老毛病。

sentences.english: Wang Yao is anxious to find out the honeysuckle lumbago again.
sentences.chinese: 王耀急着想出门找忍冬，结果腰痛的老毛病又犯了。

sentences.english: Narrow-mindedness is an old weakness of mine.
sentences.chinese: 气量狭窄是我的老毛病。

sentences.english: If the new toy is “exciting” enough, the old one will be given up with ease.
sentences.chinese: 如果新玩意足够有趣，那戒掉老毛病应该容易的很。

sentences.english: Breaking dishes was one of her failings.
sentences.chinese: 经常打碎盘子是她的一个老毛病。

sentences.english: After his divorce he reverted to his old habit of drinking.
sentences.chinese: 他离婚以后又恢复了喝酒的老毛病。

sentences.english: I have an old complaint with my heart.

definition: old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
an incompletely cured illness/an old complaint/the root cause of trouble
